Customizing the Format of HTML Reports

You can customize the HTML templates that Serena ChangeMan Version Manager uses to display journal, history, and security reports. There is one template file per type of report:

  • journal.template
  • history.template
  • accessdb.template

These files are located in the pvcsprop\pvcs\vm subdirectory of the Version Manager installation directory (for example, c:\Program Files\Serena\vm\common\pvcsprop\pvcs\vm on Windows and /usr/serena/vm/common/pvcsprop/pvcs/vm on UNIX). All three of the default template files are the same. Click to see a sample of the HTML report format.

To display the report title, the template must have the tag:

To display the report, the template must have the tag:

You can change any of the formatting tags in the template files. For example, you can customize the report by changing the color and size of the font, the background color, etc. You can also add formatting tags, any text that you want, links to other pages, and graphics files (for example, your company logo).
